ohha.puzzlecrafter.grid

Class Partition

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohha.puzzlecrafter.grid.Partition

  • public class Partition
extends Object
    Represents a partition of the puzzle grid, such as the nine 3x3 boxes of a regular Sudoku. As a Partition is a set of regions, it may not contain duplicate regions.

    Despite the name, no demands or requirements are made that the constituent regions either cover the grid nor lack overlaps. However, the class offers methods for testing this.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Partition()
      A constructor for making an empty partition.
      Partition(int regionHeight, int regionWidth, int partitionHeight, int partitionWidth)
      A constructor for making a partition consisting of a grid of rectangular regions, all the same shape.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Partition

        public Partition()
        A constructor for making an empty partition.

      • Partition

        public Partition(int regionHeight,
                 int regionWidth,
                 int partitionHeight,
                 int partitionWidth)
        A constructor for making a partition consisting of a grid of rectangular regions, all the same shape. The top-left corner of the top-left region will be at (0, 0).
        Parameters:
        regionHeight - the height of each region in cells
        regionWidth - the width of each region in cells
        partitionHeight - the height of the partition in regions
        partitionWidth - the width of the partition in regions

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Region r)
        Returns whether the partition contains the given region.
        Parameters:
        r - the region to test
        Returns:
        true if the partition contains the region, false otherwise

      • getRegionOf

        public Region getRegionOf(CellCoordinate c)
        Returns the region that the cell at the given coordinate belongs to, or null.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate of the cell whose region to get
        Returns:
        returns the region containing the given cell, or null if no containing region is found

      • isValidPartition

        public boolean isValidPartition(Grid grid)
        Not implemented yet, always returns false. Returns whether the given Partition is a valid partition covering the given grid. A valid partition must satisfy the following criteria:
        • No regions may overlap. That is, each cell may belong to only one region.
        • The whole grid must be covered. That is, each cell must belong to one region.
        • No region may contain cells that aren't in the grid.
        Parameters:
        grid - the grid to test validness on
        Returns:
        true if the Partition is a valid partition, false otherwise.

      • deepCopy

        public Partition deepCopy()
        Returns a deep copy of the Partition it was called on, deep copying the consitutent Regions.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the Partition it was called on
